crown:AdditionalMaterial.rdfs:label: Grafik, CR_1_QB_Gr_1526-1796_136
crown:AdditionalMaterial.rdfs:comment: ÜBERARBEITEN; sehr kleine, stark vereinfachte Darstellungen der RK auf den Häuptern von zwei Figuren am Reliquienschrein neben der Hl. Lanze; Plattenkrone, Bügel, keine weiteren Details

The Imperial Regalia were preserved from 1424-1796 in the Heilig-Geist Kirche in Nuremberg, and were exhibited on the Feast of the Holy Lance on the Helitumsstuhl in the marketplace across from the Frauenkirche. Some of the objects were lost in the removal from Nuremberg during French occupation; the others are kept in the Schatzkammer in Vienna. See also 1933,0102.1, a XV century German (Nuremberg) woodcut of this subject (from the Saxon collection at Gotha). On the Regalia, see: R. Kahsnitz and W. Wixon, Gothic and Renaissance Art in Nuremberg, New York/Nuremberg 1986, pp. 14-15. The handwriting probably dates from the seventeenth century, which helps date the drawing; the paper has an unidentified watermark of a small winged dragon and a hunting horn with the letters P and M. Literature: C. Dodgson, 'Woodcuts of the XV Century in the Department of Prints and Drawings, British Museum', 1935, vol.II, no. 246, repr.).

\"Twelve holy relics from the Imperial regalia, including the spear of Longinus, wood from the cross of Christ, a tooth of St John the Baptist, and links from the chains used to bind St Peter, St Paul and John the Baptist in captivity Pen and brown ink, with watercolour, over graphite\"
crown:AdditionalMaterial.gams:textualContent: 1500686 CR_1_QB_Gr_1526-1796_136 Bildquelle Grafik 17. Jahrhundert Tuschezeichnung ÜBERARBEITEN; sehr kleine, stark vereinfachte Darstellungen der RK auf den Häuptern von zwei Figuren am Reliquienschrein neben der Hl. Lanze; Plattenkrone, Bügel, keine weiteren Details
crown:AdditionalMaterial.crown:inscription: Inscription content: Inscribed with details about the relics, and the title: \"Zwölff heiligthum so in Nürnberg in der Opital Kirch oben in Chor aufgehalten/woerden die ungefehrtich Visirung der stück und gröss('s zet') dieser unten Verzeichneten Eln nach\" Verso inscribed in a later hand with 22 lines, giving details of the history of the imperial relics.
crown:AdditionalMaterial.crown:caption: nan

crown:PictorialSource.crown:owner: London, British Museum, Prints and Drawings, Rg. Nr. 1876,0510.514
crown:PictorialSource.crown:provenance: 1876 erworben vob Edward C Bigmore durch d. British Museum
crown:PictorialSource.crown:depiction: Ev. Ü.A; Hl. Lanze mit Reliquienschreinen; handschriftliche Beschreibungen der dargestellten Objekte; rückseitig handschriftliche Notizen zur Geschichte der RK
